com.foreach.across.modules.entity.registry.properties

Class DefaultEntityPropertyRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.registry.properties.EntityPropertyRegistrySupport
      • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.registry.properties.DefaultEntityPropertyRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityPropertyRegistry, MutableEntityPropertyRegistry

    public class DefaultEntityPropertyRegistry
extends EntityPropertyRegistrySupport
    Default implementation of a MutableEntityPropertyRegistry. Holds a collection of registered property descriptors.

    Optionally supports a reference to a EntityPropertyRegistryProvider. If one is present, nested properties can be requested as well. For example, if a property user is registered of type User. When requesting a property user.id the property registry for type User will be queried for the id property and a nested property will be built an stored inside this registry.

    Usually created through a EntityPropertyRegistryProvider.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    EntityPropertyRegistryProvider

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultEntityPropertyRegistry

        public DefaultEntityPropertyRegistry()
        Create a new detached entity property registry. Only properties registered directly will be available, no nested properties will be looked up.

      • DefaultEntityPropertyRegistry

        public DefaultEntityPropertyRegistry(EntityPropertyRegistryProvider registryProvider)
        Creates a new registry that will use the registry provider to look up nested properties of property types. For example, if no property user.id is registered directly, the property id will be fetched from the registry attached to the type of the user property. A custom descriptor will be built and the user.id property will be created inside this one.
        Parameters:
        registryProvider - for looking up nested properties
